text: NGC 191 is a spiral galaxy located in the constellation Cetus. It was discovered on November 28, 1785 by William Herschel. NGC 191 is currently interacting with IC 1563. For that reason was included in Halton Arp's Atlas of Peculiar Galaxies, under the section "Elliptical galaxies close to and perturbing spiral galaxies." ==References== ==External links== * Category:Cetus (constellation) 127 002331 0191 Category:Intermediate spiral galaxies Category:Interacting galaxies
title: NGC 191
